subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... I am currently becoming acquainted with a system which makes heavy use of Borland DataExpress. I do have the JavaDoc, but it doesn t help me that much.
messageBody:
Jim Dixon wrote:

> On the
> contrary: there are strong arguments for never looking beyond
> the Javadocs. If that sort of documentation is missing or is
> unreliable, the cost of using software soars.

I am currently becoming acquainted with a system which makes heavy use
of Borland DataExpress. I do have the JavaDoc, but it doesn't help me
that much. Most often it's easier to look at how the classes are used to
get an idea of what is happening. Having the source code would help me
much more, I think. YMMV.

Take care, Ilja
